result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 5th and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 5th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth N. Littlegeorge Jr. was found guilty of OWI 5th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Continue with his aftercare plan.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to start on or before June 3, 2016 at 6:00 pm.  EMP allowed, according to jail rules, and if agent approves.  Credit for 2 days.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant plead guilty to Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Priors confirmed by the court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of OWI 5th, contrary to 346.63(1)(a).  State recommended 3 years probation.  9 months conditional jail.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Continue with care plan he has.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. $600.00 fine.  Revoke DL 36 months, and IID.  Credit for 2 days.  Defense recommended:  less jail time.  Day for day credit for time spent at inpatient treatment.  Balance of State's recommendation agreed upon.  

Court ordered:   sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  9 months conditional jail.  Credit for 2 days served on the conditional jail sentence.  EMP allowed according to jail rules, if agent approves.  Start on or before June 3, 2016 at 6:00 pm.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Continue with aftercare plan he has.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. $600.00 fine, plus costs.    Revoke DL 36 months, and IID.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Information filed with the Court.  Waive reading of information.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Form filed with the court.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

Arraignment on May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Waiver of Prelim on April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Defendant has a HCN event on 3/17.  Defense requesting adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Also need to have a waiver of preliminary hearing, arraignment, plea/sentencing rescheduled to 4/11/16 at 10 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-14-2016 01:30 pm
from Attorney Gardner
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 01:30 pm
Status conference at 02-08-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Kenneth N. Littlegeorge in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failed to appear at 10-25 status conference as he was voluntarily admitted to the Maehnowesekiyah Wellness Center on October 20th and released November 18th. Court found defendant was in compliance; warrant quashed and original bond & conditions reinstated. Parties to contact Judge Becker's office to reschedule.  Copy of minutes sent to J.O.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Gardner appeared.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Gardner stated that the defendant was going in to in-patient treatment, but has not yet received confirmation of the same.  State concerned, as defendant was picked up in Monroe County on 10/5.  Warrant to issue.
Status conference at 10-26-2015 03:00 pm
